intro: Varronia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf varronia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Varronia rotundifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
